comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Irish-born Tammany Hall boss Richard Eyre Croker (1843-1922) was 71 in 1914, when he married Beulah Benton (or Benson) Edmonson (or Edmondson) (1884-1957), who was 1/16 Cherokee and an alumna of the Cherokee National Female Seminary, shortly after his first wife's passing. He left his fortune to this second wife, and not to his children; Croker's children tried to claim that the Croker-Edmonson marriage wasn't valid, but they were unsuccessful in proving their claims. The will was still being contested as late as 1937. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Croker She's buried in West Palm Beach, FL, where she owned a lot of beachfront property in later life: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=62332174
